thread.title: Watch: 3-Year-Old With Spina Bifida Gives out High Fives to Local Track Team
thread.title_full: Watch: 3-Year-Old With Spina Bifida Gives out High Fives to Local Track Team

author: Monica Grater
title: Watch: 3-Year-Old With Spina Bifida Gives out High Fives to Local Track Team
text:
First reported by WSYX ABC 6 , Mompher handed out high-fives to the runners, who are coached by Beth Lichtenberger, Mompher’s aunt. Lichtenberger’s children are also on the team, so the cheerleader surprised his cousins —twins Emma and Caleb, 13, and Ethan, 12— with his presence at practice. 
Mompher loves being outside and having space to ride around in his wheelchair, and with the weather finally permitting, it was a perfect day for him to visit the team for the first time, his mom, Megan Mompher, told Runner’s World by phone. Before practice ended, Mompher raced some of the team members in his chair. 
RELATED: Tatyana McFadden Is an Unbeatable Advocate 
“Blake loves his chair. He goes everywhere in it," Megan said. “He’s really fast and skilled with it, and he already does tricks and wheelies, and he only got it about a year and a half ago.” 
Mompher has asked his mom to watch the video of him at the track about “a million times.” (Want more great stories like this? Then sign up for the RW Warmup Newsletter for a morning dose of motivation.) 
Due to spina bifida, which causes the spinal cord to improperly develop, Mompher is paralyzed from the waist down, but his mom and physical therapist have high hopes that he will one day walk—and maybe run. 
For now, though, Mompher isn’t deterred: He loves his chair, playing with cars, McDonald’s french fries, Mickey Mouse, and Toy Story .
